item.title: Codeforces 733D - Kostya the Sculptor
item.description: 最近有点蠢 Solution WLOG, assume $a\leq b\leq c$. If we choose only one stone, the diameter of the sphere is $\frac a 2$. If we want to choose two stones, we should find another stone whose two of its edges are $b$ and $c$, since we must expand the shortest side to get a bigger sphere. item.title: Gym101981J - Prime Game
item.description: problem link To solve this problem, we need to count for each prime factors, how many intervals include them. First, let’s assume that all factors are distinct i.e. all factors only appears at one position. In this case, it’s easy to count the intervals that include them. For all primes at $p$, there are $p\cdot(n-p+1)$ intervals including them. However, one prime can appear multiple times so we need to substract the repeated intervals(interval contain the current position and last position).
